SEARCH
Module brickGame
Package brickGame

Class Block

java.lang.Object
brickGame.Block
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Block extends Object implements Serializable
The Block class represents a block in the brick game. It includes methods for drawing the block, checking hits, and retrieving block properties.

HTML Note: The HTML tags can be used for formatting purposes in the generated Javadocs.

Example usage: 

 
 Block block = new Block(row, column, color, type);
 int hitResult = block.checkHitToBlock(xBall, yBall);
See Also:

    • Block

      public Block(int row, int column, javafx.scene.paint.Color color, int type)
      Constructs a Block object with the specified row, column, color, and type.
      Parameters:
      row - The row position of the block.
      column - The column position of the block.
      color - The color of the block.
      type - The type of the block.

      Example usage: 

                     
               Block block = new Block(row, column, color, type);

    • checkHitToBlock

      public int checkHitToBlock(double xBall, double yBall)
      Checks the hit direction of the ball to the block.
      Parameters:
      xBall - The x-coordinate of the ball.
      yBall - The y-coordinate of the ball.
      Returns:
      The hit direction constant.

      Example usage: 

       
 int hitResult = block.checkHitToBlock(xBall, yBall);
